alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 11:36AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Greenwood County through NOON CDT... At 1136 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Toronto, or 13 miles east of Eureka, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fall River Lake, Fall River State Park and Cross Timbers State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
